item.title: 奇货可居：特朗普削减美国国立卫生研究院经费震惊美国科学界（播客）
item.description: 特朗普政府最先采取的举措之一就是改变美国国立卫生研究院拨款的性质。根据新政策，与特定拨款相关的 "间接成本 "上限为 15%。这笔钱主要用于支付机构管理费用，与具体项目本身的新成本没有直接关系。那么，NIH 拨款究竟是如何运作的？有哪些直接费用和间接费用？已经产生的效果如何？在本期节目中，我们将【原文：One of the first moves made by the Trump administration was to change the nature of grants made by the National Institutes of Health. Under the new policy, there’s a 15% cap on “indirect costs” associated with a given grant. This is money that essentially pays for institutional overhead, not directly related to the new costs of the specific project itself. So how do NIH grants actually work? item.title: 特朗普称印度发出准备进一步削减关税的信号
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）表示，印度已表明愿意进一步削减关税，此前他曾向印度施加更大压力，要求其降低贸易壁垒，并称这些壁垒不公平地惩罚了美国企业。【原文：US President Donald Trump said India has signaled its readiness to make deeper tariff cuts, after he ramped up pressure on the country to lower trade barriers that he has said unfairly penalize American businesses.】

item.title: 星展数码银行和自动柜员机服务遭遇长达数小时的中断
item.description: 星展集团控股有限公司的数字银行和自动取款机服务一夜之间在新加坡中断，这是这个岛国最大银行遭遇的一系列技术故障中的最新一次。【原文：DBS Group Holdings Ltd.’s digital banking and ATM services were disrupted in Singapore overnight, the latest in a series of technical glitches suffered at the island state’s largest bank.】

item.title: 欧洲央行施纳贝尔在利率辩论中发出关注通胀的信号
item.description: 欧洲央行执行董事会成员伊莎贝尔-施纳贝尔（Isabel Schnabel）表示，欧元区通胀更有可能停留在欧洲央行的目标之上，而不是持久放缓。【原文：Euro-zone inflation is more likely to get stuck above the European Central Bank’s target than to durably slow, said Executive Board member Isabel Schnabel.】

item.title: 印度大亨纳达尔将 HCL 公司和瓦玛德里的股份赠予女儿
item.description: 印度亿万富翁、HCL 技术有限公司创始人希夫-纳达尔（Shiv Nadar）已签署赠与契约，将其在 HCL 公司和 Vama Delhi 公司的 47% 股权转让给女儿罗什尼-纳达尔-马尔霍特拉（Roshni Nadar Malhotra）。【原文：Indian billionaire Shiv Nadar, who founded HCL Technologies Ltd., has executed gift deeds to transfer his 47% shareholdings in HCL Corp. and Vama Delhi to his daughter Roshni Nadar Malhotra.】

item.title: 司法部对鸡蛋价格飙升展开反垄断调查
item.description: 据一位熟悉调查情况的人士透露，美国司法部已对近期全国鸡蛋价格飙升展开初步调查。【原文：The US Justice Department has opened a preliminary probe into a recent surge in egg prices across the country, according to a person familiar with the investigation.】

item.title: 中国对加拿大菜籽油和猪肉征收报复性关税
item.description: 中国表示将对从加拿大进口的菜籽油、猪肉和海产品征收报复性关税。【原文：China said it will impose retaliatory tariffs on imports of rapeseed oil, pork and seafood from Canada.】

item.title: 千禧年战略受市场混乱影响损失 9 亿美元
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，千禧管理公司今年迄今从两个专注于指数再平衡的团队中损失了约 9 亿美元，而这一战略最近因全球股市波动而受到冲击。【原文：Millennium Management lost about $900 million so far this year from two teams focused on index rebalancing, a strategy recently upended by global stock market volatility, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 包装生产商 Silgan 正与顾问合作出售资产
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，包装生产商 Silgan Holdings Inc. 正与一家顾问公司就出售其定制集装箱业务的可能性进行合作。【原文：Packaging maker Silgan Holdings Inc. is working with an adviser on a potential sale of its custom containers business, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 化学品公司 Ascend Performance 获得拯救性融资
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Ascend Performance Materials 公司的一些债权人向这家陷入困境的化学品公司提供了新的融资，使其有时间重组债务。【原文：Some of Ascend Performance Materials Inc.’s creditors provided fresh financing to the troubled chemicals firm, giving it time to restructure its debt, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: AT&T在 DEI 解禁活动中放弃首字母缩略词，取消自豪计划
item.description: AT&T 公司不再鼓励员工佩戴标有自己喜欢的代名词的徽章，并取消了一系列对 LGBTQ 友好的活动，这是一家大公司最近一次在多元化、公平和包容方面的举措。【原文：AT&T Inc. is no longer encouraging employees to wear pins that state their favored pronouns and has canceled a series of LGBTQ-friendly events in the most recent effort by a big company to roll back its diversity, equity and inclusion initiatives.】

item.title: 亚马逊反垄断案转向关键问题：谁是亚马逊的竞争对手？
item.description: 联邦贸易委员会（Federal Trade Commission）的一名律师告诉法官，该机构仍在确定谁是亚马逊公司的竞争对手，以便在 2023 年提起具有里程碑意义的反垄断诉讼，指控这家电子商务巨头垄断在线市场服务。【原文：The Federal Trade Commission is still determining who it considers to be Amazon.com Inc.’s competitors for its 2023 landmark antitrust lawsuit accusing the e-commerce giant of monopolizing online marketplace services, an agency lawyer told a judge.】

item.title: 根据反垄断计划，谷歌可保留人类人工智能投资
item.description: Alphabet Inc. 旗下的谷歌公司（Google）可以保留对 Anthropic 等人工智能初创公司的现有投资，但根据美国司法部周五就该机构具有里程碑意义的搜索反垄断案提交的修订提案，谷歌公司在投资更多人工智能公司之前必须通知反垄断执法机构。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google can keep its existing investments in artificial intelligence startups like Anthropic, but would be required to notify antitrust enforcers before investing in any more AI companies under a revised Justice Department proposal filed Friday in the agency’s landmark antitrust case over search.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚通胀率意外加速，连续第二个月上升
item.description: 哥伦比亚通胀率连续第二个月意外加速，这使得央行在 3 月会议上支持政府降息呼吁的可能性降低。【原文：Colombian inflation unexpectedly accelerated for a second straight month, making it less likely that the central bank will back the government’s calls for interest rate cuts at its March meeting.】

item.title: 部长表示加拿大已准备好就 USMCA 和中国倾销问题进行会谈
item.description: 加拿大财政部长多米尼克-勒布朗（Dominic LeBlanc）表示，如果特朗普政府希望启动北美自由贸易协定审查进程，加拿大愿意尽早开始谈判。【原文：Canada is ready to begin early talks on reviewing the North American free trade pact if the Trump administration wants to begin that process, Canadian Finance Minister Dominic LeBlanc said.】

item.title: 纽森以成本为由下令重做加州具有里程碑意义的反塑料规则
item.description: 加利福尼亚州州长加文-纽森（Gavin Newsom）以成本问题为由，要求州监管机构重新制定大幅减少一次性塑料制品的全面规定。【原文：California Governor Gavin Newsom has told state regulators to go back to the drawing board on sweeping rules that would drastically reduce single-use plastics, citing concerns over the measure’s cost.】

item.title: 努班克投资者关系官弗里德曼将离职
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，约尔格-弗里德曼（Jörg Friedemann）将辞去拉丁美洲最大的金融科技公司 Nu 控股有限公司（Nu Holdings Ltd. ）投资者关系官的职务。【原文：Jörg Friedemann is stepping down as investor relations officer of Nu Holdings Ltd., the biggest fintech in Latin America, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 温克艾沃斯双胞胎的双子座公司秘密申请上市
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，由亿万富翁温克艾沃斯双胞胎支持的加密货币公司双子座（Gemini）已秘密申请首次公开募股。【原文：Gemini, the cryptocurrency firm backed by the billionaire Winklevoss twins, has filed confidentially for an initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: DoorDash、TKO、Williams-Sonoma 和 Expand Energy 加入 S&P 500 指数
item.description: DoorDash Inc.、TKO Group Holdings Inc.、Williams-Sonoma Inc.和 Expand Energy Corp. 将在最新的季度权重变动中被纳入 S&P 500 指数。【原文：DoorDash Inc., TKO Group Holdings Inc., Williams-Sonoma Inc. and Expand Energy Corp. will be added to the S&P 500 index in the latest quarterly weighting change.】

item.title: Robinhood 将支付 2600 万美元解决 Finra 指控
item.description: Robinhood Markets Inc. 的两个部门同意支付 2,600 万美元，以了结金融业监管局的指控，即该公司未能对潜在不当行为的警示做出反应，也没有核实数千名客户的身份。【原文：Two units of Robinhood Markets Inc. agreed to pay $26 million to settle Financial Industry Regulatory Authority allegations that it failed to respond to red flags about potential misconduct and didn’t verify the identities of thousands of customers.】

item.title: Cognizant 因报告激进分子 Mantle Ridge 持股而上涨
item.description: 华尔街日报》报道称，激进投资者 Mantle Ridge 已持有这家技术服务公司超过 10 亿美元的股份，并认为其股价被低估，Cognizant Technology Solutions Corp. 的股价在尾盘交易中最多上涨了 8.5%。【原文：Cognizant Technology Solutions Corp. shares rose as much as 8.5% in late trading after the Wall Street Journal reported that activist investor Mantle Ridge has built a stake of more than $1 billion in the technology services firm and believes its stock is undervalued.】

item.title: 华尔街大跌给美国富裕家庭带来压力
item.description: 华尔街交易员本周遭遇了自美联储 2023 年货币紧缩运动达到顶峰以来最大的跨资产损失。这要归咎于关税、经济增长放缓、欧洲可能重振等因素。【原文：Wall Street traders this week were hit by the biggest cross-asset losses since the Federal Reserve’s monetary-tightening campaign peaked in 2023. Blame tariffs, softening growth, a potentially revitalized Europe, and more.】

item.title: DBRS因希腊财政表现优异上调希腊评级
item.description: Morningstar DBRS 上调了希腊的评级，理由是希腊财政表现优异，银行业有所改善。【原文：Morningstar DBRS upgraded Greece’s rating status, citing fiscal overperformance and an improved banking sector as key drivers.】

item.title: 电动汽车制造商尼古拉宣传亚利桑那州工厂在特朗普关税下的价值
item.description: 破产的电动汽车制造商尼古拉公司（Nikola Corp.）获得法院许可，拍卖其在亚利桑那州的生产设施，债权人表示，由于特朗普政府继续在实施关税问题上反反复复，这项资产可能对汽车制造商特别有价值。【原文：Bankrupt electric vehicle maker Nikola Corp. won court permission to auction its Arizona manufacturing facility, an asset creditors said may prove especially valuable to automakers as the Trump administration continues to go back-and-forth on implementing tariffs.】
